Package ohos.agp.components.element

Class Element

  • java.lang.Object
    • ohos.agp.components.element.Element
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    ElementContainer, ElementWrapper, LayerElement, PixelMapElement, ShadowElement, ShapeElement, VectorElement

    public abstract class Element
extends Object
    An abstract class of something that can be drawn.

    When static images need to be displayed in an application, this class and its child classes can be used to draw shapes and images. These child classes can resolve issues in specific image use situations.

    Since:
    1

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      static class  Element.ConstantState
      An abstract class of Element used to store constant states and data shared by Elements instances.
      static interface  Element.OnBoundsChangeListener
      Provides a callback to listen for changes of element bounds.
      static interface  Element.OnChangeListener
      Provides a callback to listen for element changes.
      static interface  Element.OnLayoutDirectionChangeListener
      Provides a callback to listen for element layout direction changes.
      protected static interface  Element.OnRankChangeListener
      Provides a callback to listen for Element rank change.

    • Constructor Detail

        Default constructor used to create an Element object.

      • Element

        public Element​(Object source)
        A constructor used to create an Element object based on a specified Object.
        Parameters:
        source - Indicates the resources used for native initialization.
        Since:
        4

      • Element

        public Element​(Resource resource,
               boolean decodeImmediately)
        A constructor used to create an Element object based on a specific Resource.

        This method is mostly used by PixelMapElement created from Resource.

        Parameters:
        resource - Indicates the resource to decode.
        decodeImmediately - Specifies whether to decode the resource immediately. The value true means to decode the resource immediately (to start decoding upon the creation), and false means the opposite.
        Since:
        7

    • Method Detail

      • setAlpha

        public void setAlpha​(int alpha)
        Sets the alpha value of an element object.

        Value 0 indicates complete transparency, and value 255 indicates complete opacity.

        Parameters:
        alpha - Indicates the alpha value.
        See Also:
        getAlpha()

      • getAlpha

        public int getAlpha​()
        Obtains the alpha value of an element object.

        Value 0 indicates complete transparency, and value 255 indicates complete opacity. This method is implemented by Element child classes. The default alpha value is 255.

        Returns:
        Returns the alpha value.
        See Also:
        setAlpha(int)

      • setRank

        public final boolean setRank​(int rank)
        Set the rank value for the Element.

        This change an element appearance depending on the rank.

        Parameters:
        rank - Indicates the rank to set, ranging from 0 to 10000.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the change is applied and OnRankChangeListener is set; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        7

      • getRank

        public final int getRank​()
        Obtains the rank of this Element.
        Returns:
        Returns the rank, ranging from 0 to 10000.
        Since:
        6
        See Also:
        setRank(int)

      • setOnRankChangeListener

        protected void setOnRankChangeListener​(Element.OnRankChangeListener listener)
        Listens for rank changes of this Element.
        Parameters:
        listener - Indicates the listener to be used.
        Since:
        6
        See Also:
        Element.OnRankChangeListener

      • drawToCanvas

        public void drawToCanvas​(Canvas canvas)
        Draws an Element object on the canvas.
        Parameters:
        canvas - Indicates the canvas on which to draw the element.
        Since:
        3

      • setVisible

        public boolean setVisible​(boolean visible,
                          boolean restart)
        This method doesn't change the visibility of an Element. Mostly used for Elements which supports animation to pause/resume their animation.
        Parameters:
        visible - Specifies whether the Element object is playing animation or not. Value true indicates that the animation will be resumed and false indicates that the animation will be paused.
        restart - Specifies whether to restart the animation of the Element object. Value true indicates that the animation will be restarted from the first frame and false indicates the animation will be resumed from the most recent frame.
        Returns:
        boolean Returns true if the latest visible state is different from the previous state; returns false otherwise.
        See Also:
        isVisible()

      • getVisible

        @Deprecated
public boolean getVisible​()
        Deprecated. This change is effective since API version 8. Replaced by isVisible()
        Obtains the visible state of a public Element object.
        Returns:
        boolean Returns the visible state of the Element object.
        See Also:
        setVisible(boolean, boolean)

      • isVisible

        public boolean isVisible​()
        Checks whether this Element is visible.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the Element is visible; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        7
        See Also:
        setVisible(boolean, boolean)

      • isStateful

        public boolean isStateful​()
        Checks whether the state of an Element object is changed based on the component state.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the Element object state is changed; returns false otherwise.

      • getCurrentElement

        public Element getCurrentElement​()
        Obtains the Element object in use.
        Returns:
        Returns the Element object in use in normal cases; returns the child Element object in use if an ElementContainer is used.

      • release

        @Deprecated
public void release​()
        Deprecated. This change is effective since API version 8. Method is no longer used.
        Releases all resources.

        If a component is using the Element object, a runtime exception is thrown. When a ElementContainer object is released, all child Element objects are released.

      • setBounds

        public void setBounds​(int left,
                      int top,
                      int right,
                      int bottom)
        Sets the bounds of an Element object using a Rect object.

        NOTE: Bound values could be ignored by some components and Element object can be adjusted to fill container for it.

        Parameters:
        left - Indicates the left bound of the Element object, in pixels.
        top - Indicates the top bound of the Element object, in pixels.
        right - Indicates the right bound of the Element object, in pixels.
        bottom - Indicates the bottom bound of the Element object, in pixels.
        See Also:
        getBounds(), setBounds(Rect)

      • setBounds

        public void setBounds​(Rect bounds)
        Sets the bound of rectangle an Element object using a Rect object.

        NOTE: bounds value could be ignored by some components and Element object can be adjusted to fill container for it.

        Parameters:
        bounds - Indicates the bounds.
        See Also:
        getBounds(), setBounds(int, int, int, int)

      • getBounds

        public final Rect getBounds​()
        Obtains the bounds rectangle of an Element object.

        NOTE: Bounds value could be ignored by some components and Element object can be adjusted to fill container for it.

        Returns:
        Returns the bounds rectangle.
        See Also:
        setBounds(Rect), setBounds(int, int, int, int)

      • setOnBoundsChangeListener

        protected void setOnBoundsChangeListener​(Element.OnBoundsChangeListener listener)
        Listens for bounds changes of this Element.
        Parameters:
        listener - Indicates the listener to be used. (Bounds changes are the result of setBounds(ohos.agp.utils.Rect).)
        Since:
        7
        See Also:
        getBounds(), setBounds(Rect), setBounds(int, int, int, int)

      • getWidth

        public int getWidth​()
        Obtains the width of this Element object.
        Returns:
        Returns the element width; returns -1 if the element width was not set.
        Since:
        3

      • getHeight

        public int getHeight​()
        Obtains the height of this Element object.
        Returns:
        Returns the element height; returns -1 if the element height was not set.
        Since:
        3

      • getMinWidth

        public int getMinWidth​()
        Obtains the minimum Element width suitable for the layout. If the element is used as the background of a component,the width of the component must be greater than or equal to the obtained width.
        Returns:
        Returns the suitable element width; returns 0 if the element width was not set.
        Since:
        3

      • getMinHeight

        public int getMinHeight​()
        Obtains the minimum Element height suitable for the layout. If the element is used as the background of a component,the height of the component must be greater than or equal to the obtained height.
        Returns:
        Returns the suitable element height; returns 0 if the element height was not set.
        Since:
        3

      • setColorMatrix

        public void setColorMatrix​(ColorMatrix matrix)
        Sets the color matrix for this Element object.

        Element colors and the alpha value can be changed by using the color matrix.

        Parameters:
        matrix - Indicates the color matrix used as a filter.
        Since:
        3

      • getColorMatrix

        public ColorMatrix getColorMatrix​()
        Obtains the color matrix of this Element object.
        Returns:
        Returns the color matrix.
        Since:
        3

        Clears the color matrix of this Element object.
        Since:

      • setStateColorList

        @Deprecated
public void setStateColorList​(int[][] colorState,
                              int[] colors)
        Deprecated. Please use setStateColor(ohos.agp.colors.StateColor)
        Sets Element states and their corresponding colors.

        The length of the state list must equal that of the color list.

        Parameters:
        colorState - Indicates a list of element states. The value can be obtained from the ComponentState class.
        colors - Indicates a list of colors corresponding to the element states. The value can be obtained from the Color class.
        Since:
        4
        See Also:
        ComponentState, Color

      • setStateColor

        public void setStateColor​(StateColor color)
        Sets StateColor to Element. Note: When this function is called content of StateColor object is copied and any later changes of this object will not affect Element. If you need to apply these changes, call this function again.
        Parameters:
        color - Indicates a StateColor to set.
        Since:
        7

      • setStateColorMode

        public void setStateColorMode​(BlendMode mode)
        Sets a BlendMode object for this Element object.

        This method applies the colors listed in BlendMode to this Element object.

        Parameters:
        mode - Indicates the BlendMode object to set.
        Since:
        4

      • getStateColorMode

        public BlendMode getStateColorMode​()
        Obtains the BlendMode instance of this Element.
        Returns:
        Returns the BlendMode instance.
        Since:
        7

      • setCallback

        public void setCallback​(Element.OnChangeListener listener)
        Sets a listener for element attribute changes, such as the attributes set by setVisible(boolean, boolean), setBounds(int, int, int, int), and setColorMatrix(ohos.agp.render.ColorMatrix).
        Parameters:
        listener - Indicates the listener to set.
        Since:
        3

      • getCallback

        public Element.OnChangeListener getCallback​()
        Obtains the listener for element attribute changes
        Returns:
        Returns the listener; returns null if the listener was not set.
        Since:
        4

      • skipAnimation

        public void skipAnimation​()
        Skips the animation of this Element object.
        Since:
        3

      • setLayoutDirection

        public final boolean setLayoutDirection​(Component.LayoutDirection layoutDirection)
        Sets the layout direction for this Element.
        Parameters:
        layoutDirection - Indicates the layout direction to set.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the Element needs invalidation (re-drawing); returns false otherwise.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Throws this exception if layoutDirection is not Component.LayoutDirection#LTR or Component.LayoutDirection#RTL.
        Since:
        7
        See Also:
        getLayoutDirection(), Element.OnLayoutDirectionChangeListener, Component.LayoutDirection

      • getLayoutDirection

        public Component.LayoutDirection getLayoutDirection​()
        Obtains the resolved layout direction for this Element.
        Returns:
        Returns the resolved layout direction.
        Since:
        7
        See Also:
        setLayoutDirection(LayoutDirection), Element.OnLayoutDirectionChangeListener, Component.LayoutDirection

      • setOnLayoutDirectionChangeListener

        protected void setOnLayoutDirectionChangeListener​(Element.OnLayoutDirectionChangeListener listener)
        Listens for layout direction changes of this Element.
        Parameters:
        listener - Indicates the listener to be used. (Layout direction changes are the result of setLayoutDirection(ohos.agp.components.Component.LayoutDirection).)
        Since:
        7
        See Also:
        getLayoutDirection(), setLayoutDirection(LayoutDirection), Component.LayoutDirection

      • setInheritDirection

        public void setInheritDirection​(boolean followRTL)
        Sets whether the element, which is used by a component as the background, inherits the component's layout when layoutDirection of the component is RTL (that is, mirror display).
        Parameters:
        followRTL - Indicates whether the element inherits the component's layout when layoutDirection of the component is RTL. Value true indicates that the element inherits the component's layout; value false indicates the opposite.
        Since:
        4
        See Also:
        Component.LayoutDirection

      • isInheritDirection

        public boolean isInheritDirection​()
        Checks whether an element inherits the layout of the component that uses the element as the background when layoutDirection of the component is RTL.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the element inherits the layout of the component that uses the element as the background; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        4
        See Also:
        Component.LayoutDirection

      • getPadding

        public Optional<Rect> getPadding​()
        Obtains the padding of this Element.
        Returns:
        Returns the Optional object with the padding inside of Rect if the Element has padding.
        Since:
        7
        See Also:
        setBounds(Rect), getBounds()
